channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024030807
item.description:
Report X-2024030807

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: NEWBURGH

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA WAS CALLED TO THE TRAILER TO CHECK ON PACKAGE UPON FURTHER INSPECTION QAS NOTICED THAT CAP WAS LOOSE AND LEAKING ITEM WAS PULLED FROM TRAILER DescribePack: THE CAP WAS LOOSE AND MIGHT HAVE BEEN DUE TO THE MISHANDLING OF THE PACKAGE MIGHT OF DROPPED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM THE TRAILER AND PLACED IN A SALVAGE JUG

item.title: Report X-2024030715
item.description:
Report X-2024030715

  • City: BRONX
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Orientation arrows were not followed which caused the contents to leak. DescribePack: Failure was caused by not following orientation arrows. Package was loaded with the cap down. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was returned to the upright position to stop the leakage and brought back to the station.

item.title: Report X-2024030903
item.description:
Report X-2024030903

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: EAST SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler unloaded the package off of trailer, alerted QA that it was leaking, and QA isolated the package by putting it in a hazmat tote. Liquid did not physically leave the surface of box. DescribePack: Exterior packaging was wet. Upon further inspection interior was wet and one bottle was lower in amount than the rest, but all 4 caps were in place albeit loose. Interior residue on bottles. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately removed from sort and placed in hazmat tote.

item.title: Report E-2024030318
item.description:
Report E-2024030318

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: FALCONER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was at another delivery making a delivery when he noticed a shipment of pails on his truck slightly leaning. In a proactive measure, the driver decided to take the shipment off the truck at the current customer he was at to restack and stretch wrap it before something bad happened. When taking the shipment off of his trailer when he was crossing the dockplate with the shipment three pails fell off of the pallet contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was contained and confined and an outside response company was called in to help cleanup and remediate.

DescribePack: The cap on the paint can was loose which caused paint to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was contained in a Haz bin.

item.title: Report E-2024030365
item.description:
Report E-2024030365

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-24
  • City: SILVER SPGS
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROCHESTER & SOUTHERN RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RSR Crew was inspecting a set of cars in Silver Springs Siding that NS had set out. Crew noticed car #UTLX 209221 leaking diesel fuel and immediately notified RSR Trainmaster, Matthew Quattrone and Director Environmental Rita Mager. Car UTLX 209221 was set out by NS about 12 hours before RSR crew got there and were not sure how long it had been leaking. It was a slow leak - about 1 drop every 12 to 15 seconds. RSR Crew contained the spill. Rita Mager contacted SPSI who responded to site for repairs to car. Per SPSI, repairs noted as 'Tightened the packing nut of the valve stem packing to stop the leak." Report sent to car owner, who issued the OTMA.
